pullRequest.body:
See relevant zulip discussions [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/270676-lean4/topic/MVars.20from.20implicit.20variables/near/394893597) and [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113488-general/topic/apply.20at/near/394509077)

nodes.body: I had already looked at this while it was developing.  Maybe, it makes sense to add the example in the Zulip chat as a test for the tactic?  Or something that is useful for NNG4?

Also, I still wonder whether it would be better to use `apply` rather than building the term "by hand" with `mkAppOptM'`.  I think that `apply` would be more robust and might see through some `DefEq`s that the explicit term would not.  I will not have time to see if I can find an example where one method works and the other does not, but I would probably try with something like `apply f.Injective at (f a = f b)`.

Thanks for the review!

> Looks very clean, and the test cases seem extensive!
> 
> (I don't fully understand why `mkAppOptM' f (x |>.map fun e => some e))` does something different than `mkAppM' f x)`, but that's unrelated to this PR.)

I tried changing to `mkAppM'` and indeed that makes some of the tests fail. I can't say that I fully understand why, and I don't have much time to investigate right now, unfortunately. So I just left it with `mkAppOptM'` for now.

One last thought I just had, it would be awesome if `apply f at a b ⊢` and `apply f at *` were valid syntax, for consistency with other tactics. But I think that could be a follow-up PR.

(oops, I accidentally merged master and pushed :/ meant for another branch. but I guess it doesn't hurt)
bors merge

Thanks! However, this definitely requires tests.

Looks very clean, and the test cases seem extensive!

(I don't fully understand why `mkAppOptM' f (x |>.map fun e => some e))` does something different than `mkAppM' f x)`, but that's unrelated to this PR.)
Thanks! However, this definitely requires tests.

Looks very clean, and the test cases seem extensive!

(I don't fully understand why `mkAppOptM' f (x |>.map fun e => some e))` does something different than `mkAppM' f x)`, but that's unrelated to this PR.)

```suggestion
    throwErrorAt i m!"Identifier {i} not found"
```
This underlines where the error actually is.
Thanks! Done.
This function has nothing to do here, it should be in some utility file, ultimately scheduled for move to sdt4.
I agree. Do you have a suggestion for where it should be moved? Perhaps in `Mathlib/Lean/Meta/Basic`, given that `forallMetaTelescopeReducing` appears in `Lean/Meta/Basic` in core?
Ok, moved to `Mathlib/Lean/Meta/Basic`.
Did you really meant "function" here?
I reworded this a bit.

```suggestion
  exact (a, g)
```

```suggestion
  exact (a, b)
```
done.

```suggestion
  exact (a, b)
```
done
Could you additionally import `ApplyAt` in `Mathlib/Tactic/Common.lean`, too?
Done!

Two more tests to test the content of the error messages as well:

```lean
/--
error: Failed to find γ as the type of a parameter of α → β.
-/
#guard_msgs in
example {α β γ : Type*} (f : α → β) (g : γ) (a : α) : β × γ  := by
  apply f at g

/--
error: Failed: α is not the type of a function.
-/
#guard_msgs in
example {α β : Type*} (a : α) (_b : β) : α × β := by
  apply a at _b
```
Added these tests. Thanks!

```suggestion
```
Done

```suggestion
  let mut mvs : Array Expr := ms
  let mut bis : Array BinderInfo := bs
```
Thanks, done.

```suggestion
  let some ldecl := (← getLCtx).findFromUserName? i.getId
    | throwErrorAt i m!"Identifier {i} not found"
```
Done.

```suggestion
  for (m, b) in mvs.zip bis do
```
done

I would personally prefer if the docstring explained at least the return types instead of just linking to `forallMetaTelescopeReducing ` which in turn links to `forallMetaTelescope`. But I don't know the mathlib-standard in this regard.
Agreed. done.

```suggestion

/-- `apply at` cannot clear mvarid if still used. -/
example {α : Type} (γ : α → Type) (a : α) (f : α → γ a) : γ a := by
  apply f at a
  rename_i a₂
  guard_hyp a :ₛ γ a₂
  exact a

```
(maybe not useful, but I wrote that trying to understand what `mainGoal.tryClear` does.)
I think it's useful. Adding it now.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `apply _ at _` tactic
